DOC.brief_summary: A clinical and radiographic evaluation of Nano-crystalline hydroxyapatite silica gel in comparison with bone allograft and open flap debridement for management of periodontal intrabony defects.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Nano-crystalline Hydroxyapatite Silica Gel in Management of Periodontal Intrabony Defects
DOC.detailed_description: Thirty patients suffering from advanced chronic periodontitis were included in this randomized controlled clinical trial. Each subject contributed matched two- or three-walled intrabony defects. Patients were equally randomly assigned into the experimental group; Nano-crystalline hydroxyapatite silica gel or the positive control group; bone allograft or negative control group;open flap debridement. Clinical and radiographic parameters were recorded at baseline and at 3 and 6 months postoperatively.
DOC.criteria: Severe chronic periodontitis patients. having at least one site with pocket depth ≥ 6 mm and clinical attachment level ≥ 5 mm, with radiographic evidence of bone loss as detected in periapical radiographs. Pregnant women Subjects had <22 permanent teeth Having any given systemic disease Taking any type of medication and/or antibiotic therapy during the 3 months before the study Received periodontal treatment within the past 12 months Current or former smokers
